item.title: Doug add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Doug add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "He inched his way up the corridor as if he would rather be yarding his way down it, which was true." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Doug add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I'm up to here with cool, okay? I am so amazingly cool you could keep a side of meat in me for a month. I am so hip I have difficulty seeing over my pelvis." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Doug add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "It struck him as curious that you could create dead men but not living ones. Comrade Ogilvy, who had never existed in the present, now existed in the past, and when once the act of forgery was forgotten, he would exist just as authentically, and upon the same evidence, as Charlemagne or Julius Caesar." -- George Orwell

item.title: Doug add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "It was like struggling with some crushing physical task, something which one had the right to refuse and which one was nevertheless neurotically anxious to accomplish." -- George Orwell

item.title: Doug add a quote by Wil Wheaton
item.description: "Remember what it was like on Christmas when you woke up before your parents, and had to sit there until they were ready, knowing that just a few rooms away there was something awesome waiting for you? For the next thirty minutes, I felt that way, while I waited for them to call me back up to the set." -- Wil Wheaton

item.title: Doug add a quote by Austin Kleon
item.description: "If you ever find that you're the most talented person in the room, you need to find another room." -- Austin Kleon

item.title: Doug add a quote by Austin Kleon
item.description: "You don’t get to pick your family, but you can pick your teachers and you can pick your friends and you can pick the music you listen to and you can pick the books you read and you can pick the movies you see. You are, in fact, a mashup of what you choose to let into your life. You are the sum of your influences. The German writer Goethe said, "We are shaped and fashioned by what we love." -- Austin Kleon

item.title: Doug add a quote by Austin Kleon
item.description: "Draw the art you want to see, start the business you want to run, play the music you want to hear, write the books you want to read, build the products you want to use – do the work you want to see done." -- Austin Kleon
